intro: Hieracium substrictipilum, commonly known as the slender-haired hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–50 cm, featuring hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, often blooming from June to August. It thrives in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and is often found in temperate climates.
